review_body: Great position for Honolulu and Waikiki. We are mid 60’s travellers and found the hotel great for us to walk both to Diamond Head and Down Town Honolulu.Easy checkin. The room had all it said it had. Our room was near the front so a little noisy but nothing we couldn’t handle. Staff mostly very friendly and helpful. I think the room might have benefitted from a little more attention when being cleaned especially in the bathroom, also the bottom sheet on the bed never covered the mattress! We had a great breakfast in the bar area on the last day. All in all a great little place to stay.

We recently stayed here in March and this hotel went above and beyond expectations! If your looking to stay close to the beach/shopping of Waikiki but also have a cozy and personalized experience this is the place! We did not want to stay at another bleached out/chain resort for our honeymoon to Hawaii, so we chose the Equus, and were not disappointed! We had a better experience than we ever thought possible for such a touristy city like Waikiki.  I'm a little bit of a pillow snob, and oh theirs were so fluffy and comfortable! Every employee, reception/bar/coffee/valet, were extremely friendly and helpful! We ended up extending our stay instead of visiting at our families home to stay with them, that's how much we loved this hotel! You cannot have a better hotel and staff that is locally owned in Waikiki, definitely a hidden gem.I will recommend this hotel to everyone that I know that is planning a trip to Oahu.

Our 10 year anniversary, was spent with these wonderful people. The receptionist was amazing, that started an awesome vacation (even In the coronavirus days). This place is HIGHLY recommended. Staff is very friendly, nice location, all around awesome stay.

After an exhausting day of hiking, Chad at the Paniolo was really able to help me relax. Kept the cocktails just the way I liked them, I like whiskey so being in Hawaii I was expecting not too many people to assist with rum drinks. Chad also provided great local advice on places to go and things to see. After my time here, I traveled to North Shore but I really missed this cute, fun spot in Waikiki.

I have not yet stayed in this hotel yet, but I just called to book it and my experience with Rene was wonderful. He was very accommodating, and made me so excited for my vacation! I can not wait for our first trip to Hawaii because of this experience.

This was our second stay at The Equus, a couple of years apart. It's a wonderfully central location with a fair price ($220/day) for Honolulu. The staff is particularly accommodating, our appreciation especially to Rene who coordinated with the exceptional housekeeping staff to move us from the noisy second floor room to the sixth floor half-way through our stay. The second floor room did provide a star-studded fireworks display for new year's celebrations however! The hotel is showing age, sliding patio door barely latched, but we weren't looking for luxury, just a landing place for adventures with family. Highly recommend and will return.

I just wanted to comment that the Paniolo bar is a really fun small and intimate bar setting. Rory was phenomenal and treated every guest great at the bar. I can’t recommend this place enough, had a wonderful time

Great customer service from all the staff! Lincoln in Valet was always attentive and ready to help out. Great cafe/bar, bartenders like Bailey and the Guys (sorry guys, can’t remember your names!) mixing up great drinks and super friendly Helpful with local places to see and places eat.

This is the third time we have stayed here - fantastic location - friendly staff - personal service. We feel so welcomed here and you are so close to a locals beach away from tourist areas - close to Ala moana and the quieter end of Waikiki

We stayed for 2 nights in between stays at other places in Waikiki. Great spot!! Close to the beach and shopping. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Lincoln, a valet, was so friendly and easy to deal with. The room was as very clean and the bed super comfy. Would definitely stay here again.

Spent four nights and five days in Honolulu, HI and stayed at this hotel where I absolutely felt at home. The staff were great and very helpful specifically; Rene, Warren, Linda, and Lincoln.The room was better than I expected it to be and I was welcomed with good Island music that was a nice touch to me. Walking distance to the Ala Moana Mall and the rest of Waikiki hotels and beaches so I would recommend this hotel to first timers or people on a budget.

Great if you’re on a budget but still want a decent room! Perfect location: close to the beach, Ala Moana Center & good local eats. Priced just right & awesome customer service! Request a higher floor to avoid street noise since hotel is on a main street.

Everyone was delightful (though especially Rene, I must say;). Staff gave us tips on local attractions, and offered mats, chairs, beach towels and even boogie boards for our trips to the beach. The room was clean, pleasant, and quiet, too: a real treat with the easy proximity to both Ala Moana Center and Waikiki. Do ask about any extra charges when you book, such as parking and resort fees. Even with those rolled in, it still ended up a much more economical choice than any of the beachside hotels would have been, and the beach isn't far away. Mahalo!

Excellent location at the gateway to Waikiki. Saved a lot as compared to the bigger hotels like the Ilikai and the Outrigger Reef.Fantastic staff and very clean. Nice little coffee bar downstairs that turns into a bar bar later on in the afternoon. Walking distance from all of Waikiki and the Ala Moana Shopping Center.

Came to the islands to visit family and linelle greeted us with opens arms. Checking in was very easy thanks to both ladies - savannah and linelle. Above and beyond service So happy I booked my stay here. Looking forward to enjoying my stay.

We just landed and got to our hotel Hawaii, and Linelle and Savannah were so awesome and very welcoming for our stay. We came to visit our family and immediately right when i walked in it felt I was back home. I love it here!

The sad part is this place is wasting potential. Competent staff, professional but not friendly. Decent rooms with an odd layout sure to age of hotel but nicely remodeled. The problem... The room was not very clean. Debris everywhere, left from previous guests. No bio hazards mind you but things like safety pins and hair barrets on the floor in plain view. No the biggest problem... This place is incredibly noisy to the point of absurd. It's on a very busy street granted but there is no sound insulation at all. I have stayed in downtown hotels all over the USA and elsewhere and never anything like this. Walls are very thin to the point that conversations in the next room are totally discernable. They oddly installed commercial toilets, the airport kind that are very very loud. Whenever the people next door flushed there was a huge bang and water rush that was almost comical. I resorted to not flushing if I used the toilet in the middle of the night as not to subject my neighbors to the same. Just unacceptable. The is a small bar the is a nice gathering place and the staff that I interacted with were very nice. There is a pool that is so small and completely blocked off sunlight that I doubt it is ever used. I cannot possibly recommend unless you are desperate.

Panioli at the Equus is an excellent hotel right on Ala Moana and near Wakiki Beach. Walking distance to nice restaurants, the Ala Moana Mall, the beach and the business district. Our second time staying at the Equus and will remain a local customer anytime in Honolulu. If you don't want a mega-resort with thousands of customers, stay at Panioli at the Equus!

Amazing place with an even more amazing atmosphere! Thanks Rory for making us feel so welcome! The live music was an added bonus, which happens every weekend. We won't be walking by anymore without stopping in

Paniolo has the perfect Hawaii feel! As the last family owned hotel in Waikiki you can tell they pay attention to the little things. Rory and Mariah makes the best drinks on island! Great times and chill vibes every night. Friday night there’s live music that won’t disappoint.

Wonderful little hotel in a great location. Everyone was incredibly friendly, the atmosphere is lovely, and the open air bar/cafe is the perfect place to start and end your day! Will definitely stay here again any time I return to the island.

This is an excellent value hotel. Prices are lower than others in the vicinity (walking distance from beaches, shopping and the convention center) and we found the rooms spacious and everything clean and well-kept. There is a small coffee bar (morning) and wine/liquor bar (evening) with friendly staff and a nice sitting area (outdoors).The beds were comfortable. Street noise (our room was on the main street corner of the hotel) was quite noticeable, but at night with windows closed and the fan/AC on, it didn't hinder sleep. I don't know whether other rooms would be quieter.Parking is expensive, as at most hotels in the Waikiki area.In all, I would be happy to visit this property again when in Honolulu.

I can't say enough about the fantastic service Rene and Yoshi provided. Thank you so much!!!I travel a lot (30+ trips/yr) and I truly appreciated the way everything was handled. I highly recommend this hotel!

Easy walk to beach and shopping. Clean spacious, quiet rooms, no or little ocean view. Staff courteous. 10 floors. 21 step walk up from street. Close to #19 bus stop to airport. Appears to be locally owned.

My husband and I have stayed here before and the kindnesses, and beautiful ambience is always the same. Lovely rooms and the management when we got stuck in crisis came through instantly to help us. This is not a chain hotel. It will always be our home in Waikiki!

I normally don't stay at smaller boutique hotels. Took a chance and had a great experience. Valet great. Front desk hilarious. AC fixed by Linelle. She was awesome. 2 free welcome beers. Will stay again. Very laid back atmosphere. Had fun.

The Panilo is great if you are on a strict budget, are NOT a solo travelor, have just a short time (like need a quick sleep) or just love a noisy room. The staff was amazing, Renee really takes her time and is caring (has the Aloha spirit). This was the BEST part of the experience. The 2nd was being able to walk about 5-7min to Waikiki and could see the Friday fireworks from our room. The winds were so powerful and the window have no screens--which I think is best, they would have been blown off anyway. The room was fine. It was clean but very very basic. The street is right below the hotel and super loud. I mean LOUD.... so glad I had ear plugs. The rooms AC works fine but we kept the windows open for the Hawiian winds. it is a 1min walk if that to ABC market. Happy that it was safe ... especially as the lobby is open... the stariwell and elevator are accessible to ANYONE. No keycard needed for entry....If I was a single woman, i would not stay here

Really enjoyed our stay. Great location for the marathon, shopping & eateries. Room very clean. Friendly staff. Bartender Bailey was great and Kika really exemplifies the Aloha spirit. Everyone was so nice. I will definitely stay there again.

I spent a weekend at the equus before a a week in Honolulu on business at another hotel. I was pleasantly surprised by my room, which was bigger and more modern than I expected based on pics. Room was clean and comfortable, though had some odd unfinished details. The staff were so so nice and helpful with any questions, recommendations, etc. The cafe is as nice for breakfast and coffee. Pool looked nice too, but I didn’t swim. I was disappointed to see no lounge chairs or sunny space around the pool, but overall very happy with my stay.

So much love and aloha to Bailey at the bar called Paniolo. She offered so much insight into her experiences in Hawaii and made us feel right at home. She is the kind of person that we will definitely visit again! We need more humans like her!
Pros:1. Friendly hotel staff2. Clean 3. Location was okayCons:1. You might get better hotel in the price you are paying for this hotel2. Really small room3. There is an additional 30$ parking fee

Nice Kama’aina getaway. The breakfast panini is delicious. Convenient location away from the crowds. You feel the ole aloha spirit here. I’d visit again. Parking as usual in Waikiki is a premium or I’d frequent the bar more often when not a guest.

All around great with special service by Rene & Lincoln. Thank you for being so gracious! We would stay there again in the future. Simple, touch of style, clean, quiet and close to the busy area and just outside at the same time.

This is not a paid review. I'm an Aussie software engineer and can be picky about hotels. Paniolo were simply fantastic. Friendly and lovely and Hawaiian and local - they were just a pleasure to deal with. I came in very early from a flight and they sorted out an open room. Can't say a bad word against them.

This is the first time I stayed here and the location was perfect. The only thing that surprised me was that it did not seem to handicap accessible. But being as I wasn't handicapped, that didn't affect me personally. Overall, it was a pleasant stay with a nice room, comfy bed and pillows, and internet access for work.

Great find. An intimate boutique hotel, well worth the price. Very friendly welcome and departure. Just off Waikiki, but close enough to walk. I will stay there again. The rooms are small, but very comfortable.

The room was very clean and comfortable except for traffic noise. It didn’t quite feel right to be charged a “resort fee” as the pool was too cold to swim in (as staff explained it is not heated and in the shade all day) and there was not any other “resort” space or facilities. The free beach towel for the walk to beach was however very helpful. The staff at the lounge/coffee stop were very friendly and helpful with directions.

Loved the location in Honolulu and the people running the Hotel. Renee at the "desk" is a pure delight and was invaluable for advice on restaurants, etc. The hotel is fairly dated but the essentials are good including a comfortable bed and cleanliness. I would definitely return.

We paid through Hotwire but the lady who checked us in charged us again. When I did get my refund it was short $60! On top of that, we were over charged for a room upgrade. We spoke to Renee at check out, she said she was training new staff and that she would look it over and email that afternoon. I never heard from her and have sent emails and left messages. Still have not received my money. Do not stay here unless you want to be over charged and then ignored.

Loved the hotel. Not so big, clean comfy rooms , convenient to get to places but still kind of tucked away so it didnt seem so hectic and busy. Complimentary drink upon arrival !! Linelle , cher , and rene were all working at the time of our stay and they all were so nice , friendly and accommodating !! My friends , family and I will return!

Since this is the last family-owned hotel in Honolulu, we just loved this 66-room gem. All of the staff was so friendly and the rooms were clean. The coffee in the morning and the bar in the afternoon was such a handy feature. Can't wait to visit again!

I was very excited about coming to Hawaii until my arrival at the airport and flights were oversold. I spoke with Rene and he was very helpful. He was very friendly and nice. He was very understanding with my flight accommodations and helped! I will definitely come back sometime to visit as soon as possible.

Such a beautiful hotel! Very convenient to Waikiki, Ana Moana Center, and numerous great restaurants. Jacquie, Roy, and Rene we all great supported by great staff. Paniolo at the Equus is on my list to stay at whenever I'm in Honolulu!

The staff are friendly and helpful with information about the area. Our room was clean and well appointed, while keeping with the smaller, boutique feel. I appreciated the sustainable and green initiatives which are in place since this hotel is so close to all of the big resorts of Waikiki. Over the whole trip, all of the staff were attentive and remembered who we were. On the day of check out, we had an event which would keep us in town a few hours after the scheduled check out -- not only did they hold our bags, they even gave us a place to shower and change before heading out to the airport. I will definitely stay here again!

We stayed one night at the Paniolo before catching a plane back to the mainland.We loved the equestrian decor and above all else the attentiveness of the entire staff.Two drawbacks--the elevator is really slow, so that it is sometime faster to take the stairs.Also there was considerable street noise. Having said that, I note that we had no trouble getting to sleep without interruption until morning.

It didn’t feel like a boutique hotel but more like an apartment. It was just ok for my one night stay. I feel most comfortable in a clean, modern, comfy sheet bed and clean bathroom. This room was older but clean. What was the deciding factor on if I would return was the bathroom. It was super small but had older tile and the grout made it feel dirty to me. If they remodeled to make it look clean it would improve the entire bathroom. No space to lay toiletries on the sink. Bottom line I would have rather stayed at a best western for the price on Hotline or The Hilton Garden Inn.

Hotel is very accommodating with a last minute unexpected change on our reservation. Truly appreciate the gesture. Customer service is top notch.Location is close to the shopping center and there are plenty of restaurants to try nearby.Will definitely choose Paniolo again when in Honolulu.

Loved this hotel. Great location central to everything.The staff are awesome and very helpful. Amenities are quite nice and the rooms are clean, neat and tidy.The coffee shop and bar/lounge area are wonderful

We have stayed at the Paniolo several times in the past couple of years. Each time we have experienced a warm welcome from staff & clean comfortable rooms complete with a complimentary drink from the bar upon check in. If you want a small hotel that projects Old Up Country Hawaii, centrally located with easy access to what Honolulu offers then maybe this hotel is for you.

I really enjoyed my trip to Panolo at the equus, close to shopping, food and the beahc. The people are friendly and the rooms were great. The bar made great coffee in the morning and lovely cocktails in the evening. We will definitely be back agin.

Room was a bit musty but AC was effective in keeping it cool. Balcony was useless. Property is dated and elevator malfunctioned while we were there. Not cool when room is on the 6th floor. Couldn't use the computer in the lobby to print my boarding passes because they were out of order. Nice bartender. Minimal breakfast for $$$.

Very cute boutique hotel in a great location within walking distance of many shops and restaurants.  It is a bit noisy but that's what it will be like in any hotel located on a busy street. Staff are very welcoming and helpful. I will stay there again.

I am a (non-U.S.) Government Employee with simple needs. Room was clean, with comfy bed, coffee maker, and great shower water pressure. The front desk made sure that I got my dry-cleaning done no problem. Folks at the front desk are friendly at all times of day. When I ran out of coffee in my room (I drink excessive amounts of it), I was given more than enough extra. Free drink at the bar, and the bar staff were conversational enough to make me feel included in the scene. The cleaning staff, though I don't recall seeing them in person, were impeccable.I wouldn't describe the Equus as fancy--I believe they describe themselves as boutique, and that's fitting, it DOES have style--but the point I'm getting at is that the service I experienced was on par or superior than the service I've experienced at many larger and fancier hotels. I am willing to believe that some individuals may find the rooms to be small. For comparison, my room was larger than the Hampton Inn in New York when I attended the United Nations General Assembly, but was also smaller than my rooms at Ala Moana or Pagoda in Honolulu itself. For a simple man with simple needs, the room's size was fine. I could do everything my mobile office needed--place for the printer and scanner, place for folders and documents, and places to charge various devices. While that's the case for me, I am known to use hotel beds as my work station instead of the chair and desk (with pillows supporting my arms), and although I don't believe it's NECESSARY to do that I note this because it may not be a common practice, but it DOES result in more space being utilized elsewhere.For those unfamiliar with the setting, while I'm sure there are touristy things around--I've been to Hawaii dozens of times and I've never been to the beach--the key points for me is easy access to roads and likely meeting sites, and plenty of nearby shops when you need office supplies or 2am sushi from an ABC Store.I am pretty sure that, at some point, Hawaii will have more ABC Stores than people.In conclusion, I would recommend Paniolo at the Equus to anyone in Hawaii who needs simple accommodation and simple services performed in an exemplary manner.

Elevators were slow. Coffee bar great. Personnel super. Lots of street noise. Older decor but well maintained. Close to canal walking trail and convenience store. Walkable to beach and shopping/restaurants.

My husband and I stayed here a few weeks ago and it was a glorious experience. The hotel was clean, staff was SUPER nice (loved Renee!), the bar was wonderful and our room was clean. We were a little shocked at the noise level outside on Ala Moana, especially at night. But we were able to quickly get used to it. I felt safe leaving my personal belongings in the room while housekeeping came in daily to freshen up. There was a $20 charge on my credit card that was never removed. We have no idea what it was for or why there as we revived no extra services. Overall and absolute joy to be there. We will come back.

The Paniolo at the Equus greeted us with smiles and it was a very nice stay. It was close to everything, beach, restaurants, shopping. We enjoyed our 2 nights stay. The room was comfortable and clean.

After a rough morning of travel, the ease and comfort of this hotel was such a relief. Puka, at the front desk, was so friendly and had us checked in and in our room within 5 minutes of arrival. The room was large and clean, and the beds comfortable. We will book here again next time we are in Oahu. Mahalo Paniolo!

The room was comfortable and had the customary amenities. Service was very friendly, helpful, and efficient. The hotel’s location is convenient, as it is near a shopping center, as well as near a number of restaurants.

I was in Honolulu for a conference and made a weekend getaway out of it with my spouse. From booking to check-in to our stay, the place has the nicest staff and their aloha even comes through the phone line when I called to make the reservation! We were upgraded to a suite, which made our stay even nicer since there was plenty of room to hang out and I could get work done in the sitting room without disturbing sleeping spouse. The bathroom was so clean, even the grout between the tiles in the shower floor was clean! Very impressed. Unique and cool decor throughout the room. Friendly bartender for our complementary drinks. Though the bar/pool space was small, it was very well thought out with good use of space. Felt like an oasis in the middle of the city. This lovely boutique hotel is a little gem, and I can't wait to stay there again next trip out.

On a week long business trip and found this great place slightly off the beaten path. Not your typical tourist hotel, more of a family owned hide away. It has a 5 stool bar with lounges all around the pool.Most of the patrons were locals and everyone know each other and welcomed guests. Great hospitality, there is someone in the lobby desk area to help with directions and recommendations all day, no night shift. Place is totally laid back and economical.Staff really looks out for guests. I left a box of material with the bellboy upon check in, turns out that I didn't need it and left it behind, 2 weeks later the bell dept. calls me from Hawaii and told me I left a box behind. I no longer needed the material and asked them to toss it, which they did. A cool little slice of Aloha,Can't beat this place.Mahalo

I've stayed here twice and each time was a good experience. This most recent time I arrived at the hotel several hours before check-in and Kika was able to accommodate me so that I could check-in early. Clean, comfy, and close to nice dining areas.

Arrival access difficult with stairs to reception and no cover in rain. Overall very basic property. Also charge a resort fee with no facilities you would qualify it as a resort. Small pool with little space.We have stayed in Hawaii many times and have accepted resort fees happily where the facilities matched the word resort. Location out of Waikiki

Reasonably priced, small hotel in a central location. Rooms are clean. Lobby coffee shop, by day, and bar, by night, is a bonus. Property is a bit tired, but has everything you need without the exorbitant pricing of the larger hotels

This was part of an anniversary celebration. My husband called and booked the room for one night while we were in Waikiki. He also emailed the hotel and told them ahead of time we were celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary. We arrived around 1 PM and were told we could not check in until four. We got the distinct feeling that they didn’t even want to check if there were any rooms available. We waited around until check-in time and then they didn’t have enough employees helping to check people in. They gave us a room we did not ask for and then questioned our reservation and made me prove my room reservation. We finally got to the correct room and they gave us the absolute most noisy room possible (Street noise and traffic). The rooms overall were nice, just the people working there are not friendly or helpful. No acknowledgment of our anniversary either..

I booked Paniolo last minute for my Hawaii trip. At first they gave us a room that was on the 2nd floor, however, we didn't feel comfortable because of next door neighbors. The front desk was extremely nice and able to change our room to the highest floor and a corner room.The parking situation is a bit difficult but there's a parking lot across from Paniolo.I recommend this for a short term stay.

Everyone on staff here was very welcoming and nice to my wife and I. We were visiting on our honeymoon, and it was the best trip for us! Not too far from a lot of the activities we did and places we wanted to see.

From the start of booking, the staff of the Equus could not be more helpful, answering any questions I had and helping to set up trips and visits during our stay. Friendly, courteous and couldn't do enough for us, I felt as if I had come home to family. Thank you is all I can say, apart from I will definitely be back! A Hui Hou!

We stayed here post cruise and we were happy with our stay. Room nice and cosy. Lots of restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Beach is about 10 min walk and the hotel has towels for you to take at the beach.

Delightful, conscientious and courteous service, clean and comfortable room with quality bed and bedding, walking distance to restaurants and shops, great location with easy access to business and retail.

Only stayed two nights and was better than I thought it would be. small hotel with a very good location. the pool was small with very little sun but didn't have any time to sit in the sun. The room was clean and nice. The staff was very helpful. It was perfect for a quick two night visit.

This hotel was a hidden gem for us...we frequently stay at hotels in Waikiki and a few times at the hotel right next door and this hotel was a pleasant surprise. Very quaint and comfy place. Did not get to experience the hidden pool (again, did not expect to see a pool here and pleasantly surprised) on this trip but next time we will. Loved the 2 free drinks upon check in no other place does that! Also loved that little cafe/bar, excellent service, food and drinks! The rooms are big and spacious, loved the Keurig! The only thing I would suggest is black out curtains, the shutters are a nice touch but lets in too much light. Maybe upgrade the A/C too as at night it got hot while we were sleeping. But overall loved it! Will definitely be back!

The hotel is very outdated and loud. You can hear the traffic from the street. The shower is very small. Good for one night stay but not any more. You can hear the traffic from your room and you need to ask for two keys or you won’t be able to keep the air conditioner on while you are away. Then the room is super hot and takes hours to cool down.

Room cleaning service was great. Restocked everything everyday! Plenty of coffee, towels, and snacks. Ac was on nice and cool soon as we walked in. Great water pressure to walks off all the ocean from the beach.

The hotel smells fresh and clean. The room was spotless and fresh also. Our room service attendant, Lalaine made sure fresh towels and clean sheets were provided everyday. The pool area was great. I was very pleased with the hotel choice. I would stay here again if in the area.

Me and my Family we’re Satisfied and Happy with our stay. Besides the hotel being cute, We enjoyed our convos with our housekeeper Linnell. She always took the time to greet us and always asked if there’s anything else we need. She shows the meaning of true Aloha. That’s how we imagined people from Hawaii would be. Linnell is a one of a kind person and takes pride in how she treats her guests. We will be back and we hope to see Linnell again.

I stayed on the 3rd floor and I would like to Thank the Housekeeper Lynell for taking great care of my hotel room while I was staying there. She always greeted me with a smile and was very open and Friendly. I Love her Hospitality of attitude. She’s the kind of person you would Love to meet when you first check in to the hotel . Thank you Lynell.

I stayed at the Equus in August and stayed on the 4th floor. The housekeeper Lanelle, was very Polite everytime she serviced my room. She answered all my questions I had in what are some things i could do during my stay. Thank you Lanelle. I will be back because of her politeness.

This hotel has a good rating for trip advisor but it was way off beam for my stay.The staff are great and helpful but the noise from the freeway in the front made rooms ending in 1,2,3,4,5 pretty much unusable. Maybe if the balcony doors sealed correctly or were made of thicker glass one may not of heard the constant traffic, sirens and cars beeping till well past midnight only to begin again at daylight! I suppose you get what you pay for...but at AUD$225 per night you'd think there would be some attempt to sound proof the rooms closest to the freeway.Think twice about this hotel unless you intend to party most of the night!

A/C was not good, and was not fixed while I was there; outside balcony had major hot air blowing out, making it very hard for the A/C unit inside my room to work; small, cramped room (expected in Waikiki, I guess), but dirty and dusty lamps, faucets, etc. Not very responsive customer service, but friendly people.

My stay at Paniolo at the Equus was a very pleasant surprise as I had never visited Honolulu before and didn't know exactly what to expect. I found the staff at Equus kind, generous, and helpful! My room was well cared for, clean, and every time I needed something it was provided with a smile! The location was amazing as it was a very short walk or drive to food, shopping, and beaches; including Waikiki Beach. I also loved the cafe/bar that welcomed me when I arrived at Equus, it was a great place to enjoy breakfast and an inviting place to unwind after the day. Overall my experience in Honolulu was certainly enhanced by my stay at Paniolo at the Equus and I will definitely be back and highly recommend it!! Much love to all of you at the Equus, Mahalo!

The bathroom has a smell. In our 3 nights stay, I am pretty sure it was not cleaned well. But it was in a good location, walking distance to the beach and malls. The bed is comfy, but a lot of noise at night, we can hear other peoples conversation in our room.

Thank you everyone for making my family feel welcome and loved!!! We cannot wait to come back and spend time there again!!! Special thanks to Renee who is an angel, I would stay there just to talk story with her again !!!

One refreshing change of pace… Whoever created this small boutique hotel should be aplauded wo. Such a warm and charming gathering place with both great staff and great guestsWithin a few feet of allthe Waikiki activites, shopping and beachesIt hasa touch of the spirit of Hawaii cowboyswitha touch of poloWe will be back...Aloha nui loa from Hawaii ... Patrick

Found this little gem smack dab in the middle of the Waikiki strip. Quaint, with the nicest staff. The last private resort. Rooms are a nice size, clean and beds are comfortable. Only cons, parking is limited. Valet is a daily charge. Pool gets no sun but who needs a pool when there is a beautiful beach across the street! A short distance to a convenient store, restaurants and Ala Moana mall. Will definitely be returning!

Very charming place in Honolulu. Not your traditional hotel. Very friendly staff and comfortable stay. Close to shopping, beach, Diamond Head, and restaurants. All at a reasonable cost. Would definitely stay again.

Seriously people, whoever is rating this higher than 3 is exaggerating! The place is old and pokey. The location is about the best thing and I would recommend spending a bit more and getting something nicer in the area. The room had an overpowering sickening smell of cleaning products or air freshener and the bathroom floor was gross, so dirty with grime and strands of long hair everywhere ugh. The sheets were some polyester blend and felt horrible, I was so suss on it that I slept on towels. The service was weird and when I checked out no one offered to help with my bag down the flight of stairs and I tripped and twisted my ankle.

This place is truly a stand alone next to the mega resorts near by. Not only for its pony themed style which did not make sense until explained along with the name where really makes you question where your staying at first because it sounds like two hotels. All that doesn't really matter as what's important is how well you feel welcomed. And for me I could not have had a better experience. The people working there are some of the kindest I came across on my stay in Hawaii. Keep up the good work paniolo!Shout out Especially to the bartenders and reception crew!Side note, girl who owns the coffee shop should probably hit the road. Not a good fit.

The location is good. Me & my husband were able to walk everywhere. The rooms were small and a little dated, but that didn't bother us too much. We only came back to the room to shower and sleep. At night it can get very noisy from all the cars outside. That's not the hotel's fault due to its' location being in downtown. The lobby "cafe" is very overpriced and not good. Oh, and don't leave food or empty cups laying around, we did and woke up to ants all over the counter. Not huge ants, but still lots of them. Overall I would stay again.

When I travel for work, I like to stay on the fringes. This botique hotel was the perfect location - close but not too close to the Waikiki madness. It is located within easy walking distance of the Ala Moana shopping center, Ala Moana park, Waikiki & Hawaii Yacht Clubs, and Waikiki. The gps in my rental car didn't know how to find this place & had me driving in circles before I was able to ID the correct location. It's not easy to see this place wedged in between a couple larger structures. There is no self parking so expect to pay a daily rate if you have a car. They also charge a resort fee which seems to be standard in Waikiki. Taken together, however, the room rate was freaky good. So good in fact, it had me little worried about what I would find. The staff were all very nice. I saw other reviews about a free drink on check in. I never saw a free drink, but I can't fault them there.My room was a nice & clean, but the carpet could use a shampoo. I was pleased to find the room was not at all musty smelling (very common in Hawaii). The shower might be a sqeeze for a person of some girth, but fine for me. I appreciated the eco-friendly measures and products (although I thought the toiletry fragrance was a little on the funky side). The room had a fridge and a K-cup coffee machine (K-cups aren't so eco-friendly). As mentioned by other reviewers, you need to climb a set of stairs to get to the lobby. If you have lots of bags, this could be a challenge. That said, the valet offered to cart my luggage which I declined. Although all the valet workers were all VERY nice, there were some long wait times to get my car. Anyone staying here should be aware that Ala Moana is noisy...24 hrs/day (especially when the booze trolley is in the area). Try to get a room as far back from Ala Moana if street noise is a problem for you. Almost forgot....they put yam cookies in my room. I know that sounds a little odd, but they were really good.

review_body: Lovely service, free drink upon arrival, quiet and comfortable rooms. Easy access to all the sights of Honolulu. Good amenities provided including coffee machine in the room, secluded pool and cosy bar.

GayTravel.com had the pleasure of staying at The Equus Hotel and our experience was remarkable. All guests receive free tickets to Polo on the North Shore which we highly recommend as a great day excursion. But what makes this family-owned Waikiki property such a standout is its welcoming staff who make you feel at home. We take our paniolo (cowboy) hats off to The Equus Hotel!

Stay here! Rene and the rest of the team at the Paniolo could not have been more accommodating. One of the last locally owned hotels on the island. Lots of years at the hotel between the crew and even more good stories! We will be back.

The Equus is a good place to stay, the price was reasonable. Located central to all Waikiki and Diamondhead attractions. The room was clean and spacious, the staff was excellent and the cocktail bar/Breakfast bar was great. I would stay again

It's extremely rare to feel like your at one is at the beach inside the hotel property. Thus, this hotel does it well with the cool majestic breeze and array of sunlight through white window shutters. The staff was very friendly and welcoming: Rene, Uercila, Linda, and many others.The room was spacious, affordable, very well kept, and above all else... CLEAN amongst other hotels.Very Highly Recommendable!!

Lovely host Rene-great cocktail bar/coffee bar and live music terrific. Breeze wafting through the bar area made it very pleasant to sit and enjoy-sometimes we had to arrive early to get a seat. The lift was a godsend ad my husband has bad knees.

This is a great place for us neighbor island folks. Great welcoming staff that treat you like ohana, Rene is always warm and she takes care of everything. This place is in a fantastic location, walking distance to Ala Moana shopping center and Convention Center. The Biki bike share is just around the corner, and easy to catch Uber, Lyft or Taxi or valet parking if you drive. It is close to the beach for swimming and surfing. Walking distance from good restaurants. The coffee shop in the lobby has warm service and great coffee, she also has some homemade muffins if you are early. In the afternoon the coffee shop becomes a full service bar, nice space sharing and good drinks. We have been here several times and all the rooms we have stayed in are clean and comfortable. The beds and linens make for a good nice sleep. They are always making nice small changes to take care of the aina (land). I made the mistake of staying at another bigger name brand hotel and regretted it, won't make that mistake again, we will just come back home to the Paniolo at the Equus!

Room was small but adequate. Last call at bar was at 9:30. Waitress made great drinks but clearly wanted to get Out early. Maid service was definitely lacking, 3/5 for them. Dirty face cloths in shower never picked up. Loved the in room keurig, But they didn’t clean the coffee cups each day?! Perfect spotTo just rest your head, pool was weird.

Great staff!Great location, walking distance to Friday night fireworks, beaches, ALL the shopping- basically everything Waikiki. Affordable parking on premises. Quaint bar on site with a quiet secluded pool area. And I love that it’s locally owned!!

I stayed here for 8 days and I must say that I enjoyed my stay! The staff were friendly and helpful! They gave us a lot of places to visit as this was my first time here in Honolulu! I would recommend this hotel simply because they offer a complimentary drink for choosing to stay here as well the convenience of their location. I am definitely coming back!
